com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.platform.client.tcp

Class TcpSequentialClient<Message,Response>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.platform.client.tcp.TcpSequentialClient<Message,Response>
  • Type Parameters:
    Message - A type of data contained by TcpMessage.
    Response - A type of data contained by TcpResponse.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client<TcpMessage<Message,Response>,TcpResponse<Response>>

    @ThreadSafe
public final class TcpSequentialClient<Message,Response>
extends Object
implements Client<TcpMessage<Message,Response>,TcpResponse<Response>>
    A TCP implementation of the Client interface that is suitable only to access TCP servers that don't shuffle responses and can tolerate reuse of TCP connections by a client. I.e. TcpSequentialClient can successfully operate with a server if the following is true:
    • if the server receives messages in the same TCP connection in the order msg1, msg2, msg3, it responds to the messages in the same order msg1_response, msg3_response (some messages MAY not imply responses, so there is no msg2_response in this example)
    • the server can tolerate that client can reuse TCP connections to the server
    Echo servers and HTTP servers are good examples of servers the TcpSequentialClient can operate with.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TcpSequentialClient

        @Inject
public TcpSequentialClient(@TcpSequentialClientAddress
                                   InetSocketAddress address,
                                   @TcpSequentialClientName
                                   String name,
                                   @TcpSequentialClientWorker
                                   Integer maxWorkerThreads,
                                   @TcpSequentialClientThreadFactory
                                   ThreadFactory threadFactory,
                                   @TcpSequentialClientWorker
                                   TcpChannelInitializer workerSocketChannelInitializer,
                                   @TcpSequentialClientConnectTimeout
                                   Integer connectTimeoutMillis)
        Constructs a new instance of TcpSequentialClient.
        Parameters:
        address - An InetSocketAddress the TcpSequentialClient will connect to.
        name - A name of the TcpSequentialClient.
        maxWorkerThreads - Maximum number of Threads that process data send and received via the established TCP connections. It's RECOMMENDED to specify this value with regard to maximum expected parallel invocations of the send(TcpMessage) method.
        threadFactory - A ThreadFactory that will be used to create Threads. Thread names MAY not be the same as the threadFactory generates.
        workerSocketChannelInitializer - A TcpChannelInitializer that will be used to initialize SocketChannels. Additional ChannelHandlers MAY be added at the end of a ChannelPipeline by TcpSequentialClient. workerSocketChannelInitializer SHOULD provide at least encoder for Message (e.g. MessageToByteEncoder<Message>) and decoder for Response (e.g. ByteToMessageDecoder<Response>) objects (such encoder and decoder MAY be omitted if Message and Response are ByteBuf).
        connectTimeoutMillis - Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for connecting to the address. This argument MUST be positive.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public final CompletionStage<Optional<TcpResponse<Response>>> send(TcpMessage<Message,Response> message)
        Sends the supplied message.
        Specified by:
        send in interface Client<TcpMessage<Message,Response>,TcpResponse<Response>>
        Parameters:
        message - Message to send.
        Returns:
        A CompletionStage that represents asynchronous Optional result of the method. Optional is present if the message expects response (see TcpMessage.TcpMessage(Object, long) for details). Otherwise the Optional isn't present.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Client
        Performs a shutdown procedure. Once this method is invoked Client can't send data anymore. This method MUST be idempotent.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Client<TcpMessage<Message,Response>,TcpResponse<Response>>
